Greetings,

Redhat 8.0 changed all the build options from rpm to rpm build; For that reason
if you try to build a new rpm package using a definition like this one:

 <rpm specFile="${specfile}" topDir="${rpm}" cleanBuildDir="yes"
removeSpec="yes" removeSource="yes" />

You will get this error:
rpm:
      [tar] Building tar:
/home/josevnz/cvs/code/NBLoanDataMapper/rpm/SOURCES/NBLoanDataMapper-1.0.tar.gz
      [rpm] -bb: unknown option
      [rpm] Building the RPM based on the NBLoanDataMapper.spec file



There is an easy way to ask the RPM task to use the proper command? Looks like
is hardcoded in the code (i haven't check yet but i found nothing on the user
manual about it).

JV.
creator: josevnz@newbreak.com
